topic.name: Early Geometry Foundations
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Early Geometry Foundations in Mathematics

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify circles, squares, triangles, and rectangles.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a right angle in a shape.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a ball (sphere) and a box (cube).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name a cone (ice cream) and cylinder (can).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a sphere's lack of edges.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a straight line vs. a curvy line.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify intersection points.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify train tracks (parallel).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name a cross shape (intersecting).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify parallel lines in shapes (rectangle).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that a circle has no corners.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe shapes in the classroom.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that solids take up space.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that a line goes forever.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe the edge of a table.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that parallel lines never touch.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe street corners.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify mirror images.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify how many lines of symmetry a square has.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Sort shapes by number of sides.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the properties of quadrilaterals (trapezoid, rhombus).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between regular and irregular polygons.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Draw a pentagon, hexagon, and octagon.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain convex vs. concave polygons.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the definition of a circle as a locus of points.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Stack blocks to build.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Faces, Edges, and Vertices.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between a prism and a pyramid.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Unfold a box to see its Net.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain skew lines.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the geometry of molecular structures.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Draw a line with a ruler.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the difference between a Line (no end), Segment (two ends), and Ray (one end).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain what a Plane is (flat surface).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Label points with capital letters.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain dimensions (0D, 1D, 2D).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the undefined terms of geometry (Point, Line, Plane).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Perpendicular (making an L / 90 degrees).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain Intersecting (crossing at any angle).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Draw parallel lines using a ruler.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the perpendicular bisector.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Parallel Postulate's role in Euclidean geometry.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that both sides match.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe a butterfly.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the sum of interior angles formula ($(n-2) \times 180$).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the hierarchy of quadrilaterals (e.g., a square is a rectangle).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect diagonal lines to vertex counts.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze Euler's Formula for polyhedra ($F + V = E + 2$).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret cross-sections (slicing a 3D shape).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect 2D rotation to creating 3D solids.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze collinear and coplanar points.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret geometric notation ($\leftrightarrow$, $\rightarrow$, $-$).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the definition of 'betweenness' to segments.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze transversal lines cutting parallels.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret Alternate Interior Angles.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect slope to parallel (same) and perpendicular (negative reciprocal) lines.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Fold a paper heart in half.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Line Symmetry (Reflection).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain Rotational Symmetry (spinning and matching).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Draw the other half of a symmetrical picture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain point symmetry.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend symmetry as a principle of beauty in creation.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the properties of n-gons.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the duality of solids (e.g., cube and octahedron).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the intersection of planes in 3D space.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the distance between a point and a line.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct proofs using segment addition postulates.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the order of rotational symmetry.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret Translational symmetry (patterns/friezes).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect symmetry to tessellations.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a cyclic quadrilateral proof.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct the five Platonic Solids.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize vector equations of lines.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a geometric proof for the properties of parallel lines.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate symmetry groups.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize algebraic formulas with geometric perimeters.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize algebraic equations for normal lines.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct symmetrical functions (Even/Odd functions).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize algebraic invariance with geometric transformations.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Geometry (Shapes, Space, and the Logic of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize volume calculus (Cavalieris Principle).
